00071 /* Getter/Setter -------------------------------------------- */

00073 /* Check if ID can have AnimData */
00074 short id_type_can_have_animdata (ID *id)
00075 {
00076     /* sanity check */
00077     if (id == NULL)
00078         return 0;
00079         
00080     /* Only some ID-blocks have this info for now */
00081     // TODO: finish adding this for the other blocktypes
00082     switch (GS(id->name)) {
00083             /* has AnimData */
00084         case ID_OB:
00085         case ID_ME: case ID_MB: case ID_CU: case ID_AR: case ID_LT:
00086         case ID_KE:
00087         case ID_PA:
00088         case ID_MA: case ID_TE: case ID_NT:
00089         case ID_LA: case ID_CA: case ID_WO:
00090         case ID_SPK:
00091         case ID_SCE:
00092         case ID_MC:
00093         {
00094             return 1;
00095         }
00096         
00097             /* no AnimData */
00098         default:
00099             return 0;
00100     }
00101 }

00103 
00104 /* Get AnimData from the given ID-block. In order for this to work, we assume that 
00105  * the AnimData pointer is stored immediately after the given ID-block in the struct,
00106  * as per IdAdtTemplate.
00107  */
00108 AnimData *BKE_animdata_from_id (ID *id)
00109 {
00110     /* only some ID-blocks have this info for now, so we cast the 
00111      * types that do to be of type IdAdtTemplate, and extract the
00112      * AnimData that way
00113      */
00114     if (id_type_can_have_animdata(id)) {
00115         IdAdtTemplate *iat= (IdAdtTemplate *)id;
00116         return iat->adt;
00117     }
00118     else
00119         return NULL;
00120 }
00121 
00122 /* Add AnimData to the given ID-block. In order for this to work, we assume that 
00123  * the AnimData pointer is stored immediately after the given ID-block in the struct,
00124  * as per IdAdtTemplate. Also note that 
00125  */
00126 AnimData *BKE_id_add_animdata (ID *id)
00127 {
00128     /* Only some ID-blocks have this info for now, so we cast the 
00129      * types that do to be of type IdAdtTemplate, and add the AnimData
00130      * to it using the template
00131      */
00132     if (id_type_can_have_animdata(id)) {
00133         IdAdtTemplate *iat= (IdAdtTemplate *)id;
00134         
00135         /* check if there's already AnimData, in which case, don't add */
00136         if (iat->adt == NULL) {
00137             AnimData *adt;
00138             
00139             /* add animdata */
00140             adt= iat->adt= MEM_callocN(sizeof(AnimData), "AnimData");
00141             
00142             /* set default settings */
00143             adt->act_influence= 1.0f;
00144         }
00145         
00146         return iat->adt;
00147     }
00148     else 
00149         return NULL;
00150 }

00152 /* Action Setter --------------------------------------- */
00153 
00154 /* Called when user tries to change the active action of an AnimData block (via RNA, Outliner, etc.) */
00155 short BKE_animdata_set_action (ReportList *reports, ID *id, bAction *act)
00156 {
00157     AnimData *adt = BKE_animdata_from_id(id);
00158     short ok = 0;
00159     
00160     /* animdata validity check */
00161     if (adt == NULL) {
00162         BKE_report(reports, RPT_WARNING, "No AnimData to set action on");
00163         return ok;
00164     }
00165     
00166     /* active action is only editable when it is not a tweaking strip 
00167      * see rna_AnimData_action_editable() in rna_animation.c
00168      */
00169     if ((adt->flag & ADT_NLA_EDIT_ON) || (adt->actstrip) || (adt->tmpact)) {
00170         /* cannot remove, otherwise things turn to custard */
00171         BKE_report(reports, RPT_ERROR, "Cannot change action, as it is still being edited in NLA");
00172         return ok;
00173     }
00174     
00175     /* manage usercount for current action */
00176     if (adt->action)
00177         id_us_min((ID*)adt->action);
00178     
00179     /* assume that AnimData's action can in fact be edited... */
00180     if (act) {
00181         /* action must have same type as owner */
00182         if (ELEM(act->idroot, 0, GS(id->name))) {
00183             /* can set */
00184             adt->action = act;
00185             id_us_plus((ID*)adt->action);
00186             ok = 1;
00187         }
00188         else {
00189             /* cannot set */
00190             BKE_reportf(reports, RPT_ERROR,
00191                     "Couldn't set Action '%s' onto ID '%s', as it doesn't have suitably rooted paths for this purpose", 
00192                     act->id.name+2, id->name);
00193             //ok = 0;
00194         }
00195     }
00196     else {
00197         /* just clearing the action... */
00198         adt->action = NULL;
00199         ok = 1;
00200     }
00201     
00202     return ok;
00203 }

00205 /* Freeing -------------------------------------------- */
00206 
00207 /* Free AnimData used by the nominated ID-block, and clear ID-block's AnimData pointer */
00208 void BKE_free_animdata (ID *id)
00209 {
00210     /* Only some ID-blocks have this info for now, so we cast the 
00211      * types that do to be of type IdAdtTemplate
00212      */
00213     if (id_type_can_have_animdata(id)) {
00214         IdAdtTemplate *iat= (IdAdtTemplate *)id;
00215         AnimData *adt= iat->adt;
00216         
00217         /* check if there's any AnimData to start with */
00218         if (adt) {
00219             /* unlink action (don't free, as it's in its own list) */
00220             if (adt->action)
00221                 adt->action->id.us--;
00222             /* same goes for the temporarily displaced action */
00223             if (adt->tmpact)
00224                 adt->tmpact->id.us--;
00225                 
00226             /* free nla data */
00227             free_nladata(&adt->nla_tracks);
00228             
00229             /* free drivers - stored as a list of F-Curves */
00230             free_fcurves(&adt->drivers);
00231             
00232             /* free overrides */
00233             // TODO...
00234             
00235             /* free animdata now */
00236             MEM_freeN(adt);
00237             iat->adt= NULL;
00238         }
00239     }
00240 }

00244 /* Make a copy of the given AnimData - to be used when copying datablocks */
00245 AnimData *BKE_copy_animdata (AnimData *adt, const short do_action)
00246 {
00247     AnimData *dadt;
00248     
00249     /* sanity check before duplicating struct */
00250     if (adt == NULL)
00251         return NULL;
00252     dadt= MEM_dupallocN(adt);
00253     
00254     /* make a copy of action - at worst, user has to delete copies... */
00255     if (do_action) {
00256         dadt->action= copy_action(adt->action);
00257         dadt->tmpact= copy_action(adt->tmpact);
00258     }
00259     else {
00260         id_us_plus((ID *)dadt->action);
00261         id_us_plus((ID *)dadt->tmpact);
00262     }
00263 
00264     /* duplicate NLA data */
00265     copy_nladata(&dadt->nla_tracks, &adt->nla_tracks);
00266     
00267     /* duplicate drivers (F-Curves) */
00268     copy_fcurves(&dadt->drivers, &adt->drivers);
00269     
00270     /* don't copy overrides */
00271     dadt->overrides.first= dadt->overrides.last= NULL;
00272     
00273     /* return */
00274     return dadt;
00275 }
00276 
00277 int BKE_copy_animdata_id (ID *id_to, ID *id_from, const short do_action)
00278 {
00279     AnimData *adt;
00280 
00281     if ((id_to && id_from) && (GS(id_to->name) != GS(id_from->name)))
00282         return 0;
00283 
00284     BKE_free_animdata(id_to);
00285 
00286     adt = BKE_animdata_from_id(id_from);
00287     if (adt) {
00288         IdAdtTemplate *iat = (IdAdtTemplate *)id_to;
00289         iat->adt= BKE_copy_animdata(adt, do_action);
00290     }
00291 
00292     return 1;
00293 }
00294 
00295 void BKE_copy_animdata_id_action(ID *id)
00296 {
00297     AnimData *adt= BKE_animdata_from_id(id);
00298     if (adt) {
00299         if (adt->action) {
00300             id_us_min((ID *)adt->action);
00301             adt->action= copy_action(adt->action);
00302         }
00303         if (adt->tmpact) {
00304             id_us_min((ID *)adt->tmpact);
00305             adt->tmpact= copy_action(adt->tmpact);
00306         }
00307     }
00308 }

00312 static void make_local_strips(ListBase *strips)
00313 {
00314     NlaStrip *strip;
00315 
00316     for (strip=strips->first; strip; strip=strip->next) {
00317         if (strip->act) make_local_action(strip->act);
00318         if (strip->remap && strip->remap->target) make_local_action(strip->remap->target);
00319         
00320         make_local_strips(&strip->strips);
00321     }
00322 }

00324 /* Use local copy instead of linked copy of various ID-blocks */
00325 void BKE_animdata_make_local(AnimData *adt)
00326 {
00327     NlaTrack *nlt;
00328     
00329     /* Actions - Active and Temp */
00330     if (adt->action) make_local_action(adt->action);
00331     if (adt->tmpact) make_local_action(adt->tmpact);
00332     /* Remaps */
00333     if (adt->remap && adt->remap->target) make_local_action(adt->remap->target);
00334     
00335     /* Drivers */
00336     // TODO: need to remap the ID-targets too?
00337     
00338     /* NLA Data */
00339     for (nlt=adt->nla_tracks.first; nlt; nlt=nlt->next) 
00340         make_local_strips(&nlt->strips);
00341 }

00344 /* When duplicating data (i.e. objects), drivers referring to the original data will 
00345  * get updated to point to the duplicated data (if drivers belong to the new data)
00346  */
00347 void BKE_relink_animdata (AnimData *adt)
00348 {
00349     /* sanity check */
00350     if (adt == NULL)
00351         return;
00352     
00353     /* drivers */
00354     if (adt->drivers.first) {
00355         FCurve *fcu;
00356         
00357         /* check each driver against all the base paths to see if any should go */
00358         for (fcu= adt->drivers.first; fcu; fcu=fcu->next) {
00359             ChannelDriver *driver= fcu->driver;
00360             DriverVar *dvar;
00361             
00362             /* driver variables */
00363             for (dvar= driver->variables.first; dvar; dvar=dvar->next) {
00364                 /* only change the used targets, since the others will need fixing manually anyway */
00365                 DRIVER_TARGETS_USED_LOOPER(dvar)
00366                 {
00367                     if (dtar->id && dtar->id->newid) {
00368                         dtar->id= dtar->id->newid;
00369                     }
00370                 }
00371                 DRIVER_TARGETS_LOOPER_END
00372             }
00373         }
00374     }
00375 }

00377 /* Sub-ID Regrouping ------------------------------------------- */
00378 
00379 /* helper heuristic for determining if a path is compatible with the basepath 
00380  * < path: (str) full RNA-path from some data (usually an F-Curve) to compare
00381  * < basepath: (str) shorter path fragment to look for
00382  * > returns (bool) whether there is a match
00383  */
00384 static short animpath_matches_basepath (const char path[], const char basepath[])
00385 {
00386     /* we need start of path to be basepath */
00387     return (path && basepath) && (strstr(path, basepath) == path);
00388 }
00389 
00390 /* Move F-Curves in src action to dst action, setting up all the necessary groups 
00391  * for this to happen, but only if the F-Curves being moved have the appropriate 
00392  * "base path". 
00393  *  - This is used when data moves from one datablock to another, causing the
00394  *    F-Curves to need to be moved over too
00395  */
00396 void action_move_fcurves_by_basepath (bAction *srcAct, bAction *dstAct, const char basepath[])
00397 {
00398     FCurve *fcu, *fcn=NULL;
00399     
00400     /* sanity checks */
00401     if (ELEM3(NULL, srcAct, dstAct, basepath)) {
00402         if (G.debug & G_DEBUG) {
00403             printf("ERROR: action_partition_fcurves_by_basepath(%p, %p, %p) has insufficient info to work with\n",
00404                     (void *)srcAct, (void *)dstAct, (void *)basepath);
00405         }
00406         return;
00407     }
00408         
00409     /* clear 'temp' flags on all groups in src, as we'll be needing them later 
00410      * to identify groups that we've managed to empty out here
00411      */
00412     action_groups_clear_tempflags(srcAct);
00413     
00414     /* iterate over all src F-Curves, moving over the ones that need to be moved */
00415     for (fcu = srcAct->curves.first; fcu; fcu = fcn) {
00416         /* store next pointer in case we move stuff */
00417         fcn = fcu->next;
00418         
00419         /* should F-Curve be moved over?
00420          *  - we only need the start of the path to match basepath
00421          */
00422         if (animpath_matches_basepath(fcu->rna_path, basepath)) {           
00423             bActionGroup *agrp = NULL;
00424             
00425             /* if grouped... */
00426             if (fcu->grp) {
00427                 /* make sure there will be a matching group on the other side for the migrants */
00428                 agrp = action_groups_find_named(dstAct, fcu->grp->name);
00429                 
00430                 if (agrp == NULL) {
00431                     /* add a new one with a similar name (usually will be the same though) */
00432                     agrp = action_groups_add_new(dstAct, fcu->grp->name);
00433                 }
00434                 
00435                 /* old groups should be tagged with 'temp' flags so they can be removed later
00436                  * if we remove everything from them
00437                  */
00438                 fcu->grp->flag |= AGRP_TEMP;
00439             }
00440             
00441             /* perform the migration now */
00442             action_groups_remove_channel(srcAct, fcu);
00443             
00444             if (agrp)
00445                 action_groups_add_channel(dstAct, agrp, fcu);
00446             else
00447                 BLI_addtail(&dstAct->curves, fcu);
00448         }
00449     }
00450     
00451     /* cleanup groups (if present) */
00452     if (srcAct->groups.first) {
00453         bActionGroup *agrp, *grp=NULL;
00454         
00455         for (agrp = srcAct->groups.first; agrp; agrp = grp) {
00456             grp = agrp->next;
00457             
00458             /* only tagged groups need to be considered - clearing these tags or removing them */
00459             if (agrp->flag & AGRP_TEMP) {
00460                 /* if group is empty and tagged, then we can remove as this operation
00461                  * moved out all the channels that were formerly here
00462                  */
00463                 if (agrp->channels.first == NULL)
00464                     BLI_freelinkN(&srcAct->groups, agrp);
00465                 else
00466                     agrp->flag &= ~AGRP_TEMP;
00467             }
00468         }
00469     }
00470 }
00471 
00472 /* Transfer the animation data from srcID to dstID where the srcID
00473  * animation data is based off "basepath", creating new AnimData and
00474  * associated data as necessary
00475  */
00476 void BKE_animdata_separate_by_basepath (ID *srcID, ID *dstID, ListBase *basepaths)
00477 {
00478     AnimData *srcAdt=NULL, *dstAdt=NULL;
00479     LinkData *ld;
00480     
00481     /* sanity checks */
00482     if (ELEM(NULL, srcID, dstID)) {
00483         if (G.debug & G_DEBUG)
00484             printf("ERROR: no source or destination ID to separate AnimData with\n");
00485         return;
00486     }
00487     
00488     /* get animdata from src, and create for destination (if needed) */
00489     srcAdt = BKE_animdata_from_id(srcID);
00490     dstAdt = BKE_id_add_animdata(dstID);
00491     
00492     if (ELEM(NULL, srcAdt, dstAdt)) {
00493         if (G.debug & G_DEBUG)
00494             printf("ERROR: no AnimData for this pair of ID's\n");
00495         return;
00496     }
00497     
00498     /* active action */
00499     if (srcAdt->action) {
00500         /* set up an action if necessary, and name it in a similar way so that it can be easily found again */
00501         if (dstAdt->action == NULL) {
00502             dstAdt->action = add_empty_action(srcAdt->action->id.name+2);
00503         }
00504         else if (dstAdt->action == srcAdt->action) {
00505             printf("Argh! Source and Destination share animation! ('%s' and '%s' both use '%s') Making new empty action\n",
00506                 srcID->name, dstID->name, srcAdt->action->id.name);
00507             
00508             // TODO: review this...
00509             id_us_min(&dstAdt->action->id);
00510             dstAdt->action = add_empty_action(dstAdt->action->id.name+2);
00511         }
00512             
00513         /* loop over base paths, trying to fix for each one... */
00514         for (ld = basepaths->first; ld; ld = ld->next) {
00515             const char *basepath = (const char *)ld->data;
00516             action_move_fcurves_by_basepath(srcAdt->action, dstAdt->action, basepath);
00517         }
00518     }
00519     
00520     /* drivers */
00521     if (srcAdt->drivers.first) {
00522         FCurve *fcu, *fcn=NULL;
00523         
00524         /* check each driver against all the base paths to see if any should go */
00525         for (fcu = srcAdt->drivers.first; fcu; fcu = fcn) {
00526             fcn = fcu->next;
00527             
00528             /* try each basepath in turn, but stop on the first one which works */
00529             for (ld = basepaths->first; ld; ld = ld->next) {
00530                 const char *basepath = (const char *)ld->data;
00531                 
00532                 if (animpath_matches_basepath(fcu->rna_path, basepath)) {
00533                     /* just need to change lists */
00534                     BLI_remlink(&srcAdt->drivers, fcu);
00535                     BLI_addtail(&dstAdt->drivers, fcu);
00536                     
00537                     // TODO: add depsgraph flushing calls?
00538                     
00539                     /* can stop now, as moved already */
00540                     break;
00541                 }
00542             }
00543         }
00544     }
00545 }
