00547 /* Path Validation -------------------------------------------- */
00548 
00549 /* Check if a given RNA Path is valid, by tracing it from the given ID, and seeing if we can resolve it */
00550 static short check_rna_path_is_valid (ID *owner_id, const char *path)
00551 {
00552     PointerRNA id_ptr, ptr;
00553     PropertyRNA *prop=NULL;
00554     
00555     /* make initial RNA pointer to start resolving from */
00556     RNA_id_pointer_create(owner_id, &id_ptr);
00557     
00558     /* try to resolve */
00559     return RNA_path_resolve(&id_ptr, path, &ptr, &prop); 
00560 }
00561 
00562 /* Check if some given RNA Path needs fixing - free the given path and set a new one as appropriate 
00563  * NOTE: we assume that oldName and newName have [" "] padding around them
00564  */
00565 static char *rna_path_rename_fix (ID *owner_id, const char *prefix, const char *oldName, const char *newName, char *oldpath, int verify_paths)
00566 {
00567     char *prefixPtr= strstr(oldpath, prefix);
00568     char *oldNamePtr= strstr(oldpath, oldName);
00569     int prefixLen= strlen(prefix);
00570     int oldNameLen= strlen(oldName);
00571     
00572     /* only start fixing the path if the prefix and oldName feature in the path,
00573      * and prefix occurs immediately before oldName
00574      */
00575     if ( (prefixPtr && oldNamePtr) && (prefixPtr+prefixLen == oldNamePtr) ) {
00576         /* if we haven't aren't able to resolve the path now, try again after fixing it */
00577         if (!verify_paths || check_rna_path_is_valid(owner_id, oldpath) == 0) {     
00578             DynStr *ds= BLI_dynstr_new();
00579             char *postfixPtr= oldNamePtr+oldNameLen;
00580             char *newPath = NULL;
00581             char oldChar;
00582             
00583             /* add the part of the string that goes up to the start of the prefix */
00584             if (prefixPtr > oldpath) {
00585                 oldChar= prefixPtr[0]; 
00586                 prefixPtr[0]= 0;
00587                 BLI_dynstr_append(ds, oldpath);
00588                 prefixPtr[0]= oldChar;
00589             }
00590             
00591             /* add the prefix */
00592             BLI_dynstr_append(ds, prefix);
00593             
00594             /* add the new name (complete with brackets) */
00595             BLI_dynstr_append(ds, newName);
00596             
00597             /* add the postfix */
00598             BLI_dynstr_append(ds, postfixPtr);
00599             
00600             /* create new path, and cleanup old data */
00601             newPath= BLI_dynstr_get_cstring(ds);
00602             BLI_dynstr_free(ds);
00603             
00604             /* check if the new path will solve our problems */
00605             // TODO: will need to check whether this step really helps in practice
00606             if (!verify_paths || check_rna_path_is_valid(owner_id, newPath)) {
00607                 /* free the old path, and return the new one, since we've solved the issues */
00608                 MEM_freeN(oldpath);
00609                 return newPath;
00610             }
00611             else {
00612                 /* still couldn't resolve the path... so, might as well just leave it alone */
00613                 MEM_freeN(newPath);
00614             }
00615         }
00616     }
00617     
00618     /* the old path doesn't need to be changed */
00619     return oldpath;
00620 }
00621 
00622 /* Check RNA-Paths for a list of F-Curves */
00623 static void fcurves_path_rename_fix (ID *owner_id, const char *prefix, char *oldName, char *newName, ListBase *curves, int verify_paths)
00624 {
00625     FCurve *fcu;
00626     
00627     /* we need to check every curve... */
00628     for (fcu= curves->first; fcu; fcu= fcu->next) {
00629         /* firstly, handle the F-Curve's own path */
00630         if (fcu->rna_path)
00631             fcu->rna_path= rna_path_rename_fix(owner_id, prefix, oldName, newName, fcu->rna_path, verify_paths);
00632     }
00633 }
00634 
00635 /* Check RNA-Paths for a list of Drivers */
00636 static void drivers_path_rename_fix(ID *owner_id, ID *ref_id, const char *prefix, const char *oldName, const char *newName,
00637                                     const char *oldKey, const char *newKey, ListBase *curves, int verify_paths)
00638 {
00639     FCurve *fcu;
00640     
00641     /* we need to check every curve - drivers are F-Curves too! */
00642     for (fcu= curves->first; fcu; fcu= fcu->next) {
00643         /* firstly, handle the F-Curve's own path */
00644         if (fcu->rna_path)
00645             fcu->rna_path= rna_path_rename_fix(owner_id, prefix, oldKey, newKey, fcu->rna_path, verify_paths);
00646         
00647         /* driver? */
00648         if (fcu->driver) {
00649             ChannelDriver *driver= fcu->driver;
00650             DriverVar *dvar;
00651             
00652             /* driver variables */
00653             for (dvar= driver->variables.first; dvar; dvar=dvar->next) {
00654                 /* only change the used targets, since the others will need fixing manually anyway */
00655                 DRIVER_TARGETS_USED_LOOPER(dvar) 
00656                 {
00657                     /* rename RNA path */
00658                     if (dtar->rna_path && dtar->id)
00659                         dtar->rna_path= rna_path_rename_fix(dtar->id, prefix, oldKey, newKey, dtar->rna_path, verify_paths);
00660                     
00661                     /* also fix the bone-name (if applicable) */
00662                     if (strstr(prefix, "bones")) {
00663                         if ( ((dtar->id) && (GS(dtar->id->name) == ID_OB) && (!ref_id || ((Object*)(dtar->id))->data == ref_id)) &&
00664                              (dtar->pchan_name[0]) && (strcmp(oldName, dtar->pchan_name)==0) )
00665                         {
00666                             BLI_strncpy(dtar->pchan_name, newName, sizeof(dtar->pchan_name));
00667                         }
00668                     }
00669                 }
00670                 DRIVER_TARGETS_LOOPER_END
00671             }
00672         }
00673     }
00674 }
00675 
00676 /* Fix all RNA-Paths for Actions linked to NLA Strips */
00677 static void nlastrips_path_rename_fix (ID *owner_id, const char *prefix, char *oldName, char *newName, ListBase *strips, int verify_paths)
00678 {
00679     NlaStrip *strip;
00680     
00681     /* recursively check strips, fixing only actions... */
00682     for (strip= strips->first; strip; strip= strip->next) {
00683         /* fix strip's action */
00684         if (strip->act)
00685             fcurves_path_rename_fix(owner_id, prefix, oldName, newName, &strip->act->curves, verify_paths);
00686         /* ignore own F-Curves, since those are local...  */
00687         
00688         /* check sub-strips (if metas) */
00689         nlastrips_path_rename_fix(owner_id, prefix, oldName, newName, &strip->strips, verify_paths);
00690     }
00691 }
00692 
00693 /* Fix all RNA-Paths in the AnimData block used by the given ID block
00694  * NOTE: it is assumed that the structure we're replacing is <prefix><["><name><"]>
00695  *      i.e. pose.bones["Bone"]
00696  */
00697 void BKE_animdata_fix_paths_rename(ID *owner_id, AnimData *adt, ID *ref_id, const char *prefix, const char *oldName,
00698                                    const char *newName, int oldSubscript, int newSubscript, int verify_paths)
00699 {
00700     NlaTrack *nlt;
00701     char *oldN, *newN;
00702     
00703     /* if no AnimData, no need to proceed */
00704     if (ELEM(NULL, owner_id, adt))
00705         return;
00706     
00707     if ((oldName != NULL) && (newName != NULL)) {
00708         /* pad the names with [" "] so that only exact matches are made */
00709         oldN= BLI_sprintfN("[\"%s\"]", oldName);
00710         newN= BLI_sprintfN("[\"%s\"]", newName);
00711     } 
00712     else {
00713         oldN= BLI_sprintfN("[%d]", oldSubscript);
00714         newN= BLI_sprintfN("[%d]", newSubscript);
00715     }
00716     
00717     /* Active action and temp action */
00718     if (adt->action)
00719         fcurves_path_rename_fix(owner_id, prefix, oldN, newN, &adt->action->curves, verify_paths);
00720     if (adt->tmpact)
00721         fcurves_path_rename_fix(owner_id, prefix, oldN, newN, &adt->tmpact->curves, verify_paths);
00722         
00723     /* Drivers - Drivers are really F-Curves */
00724     drivers_path_rename_fix(owner_id, ref_id, prefix, oldName, newName, oldN, newN, &adt->drivers, verify_paths);
00725     
00726     /* NLA Data - Animation Data for Strips */
00727     for (nlt= adt->nla_tracks.first; nlt; nlt= nlt->next)
00728         nlastrips_path_rename_fix(owner_id, prefix, oldN, newN, &nlt->strips, verify_paths);
00729         
00730     /* free the temp names */
00731     MEM_freeN(oldN);
00732     MEM_freeN(newN);
00733 }
00734 
00735 /* Whole Database Ops -------------------------------------------- */
00736 
00737 /* apply the given callback function on all data in main database */
00738 void BKE_animdata_main_cb (Main *mainptr, ID_AnimData_Edit_Callback func, void *user_data)
00739 {
00740     ID *id;
00741 
00742     /* standard data version */
00743 #define ANIMDATA_IDS_CB(first) \
00744     for (id= first; id; id= id->next) { \
00745         AnimData *adt= BKE_animdata_from_id(id); \
00746         if (adt) func(id, adt, user_data); \
00747     }
00748     
00749     /* "embedded" nodetree cases (i.e. scene/material/texture->nodetree) */
00750 #define ANIMDATA_NODETREE_IDS_CB(first, NtId_Type) \
00751     for (id= first; id; id= id->next) { \
00752         AnimData *adt= BKE_animdata_from_id(id); \
00753         NtId_Type *ntp= (NtId_Type *)id; \
00754         if (ntp->nodetree) { \
00755             AnimData *adt2= BKE_animdata_from_id((ID *)ntp); \
00756             if (adt2) func(id, adt2, user_data); \
00757         } \
00758         if (adt) func(id, adt, user_data); \
00759     }
00760     
00761     /* nodes */
00762     ANIMDATA_IDS_CB(mainptr->nodetree.first);
00763     
00764     /* textures */
00765     ANIMDATA_NODETREE_IDS_CB(mainptr->tex.first, Tex);
00766     
00767     /* lamps */
00768     ANIMDATA_IDS_CB(mainptr->lamp.first);
00769     
00770     /* materials */
00771     ANIMDATA_NODETREE_IDS_CB(mainptr->mat.first, Material);
00772     
00773     /* cameras */
00774     ANIMDATA_IDS_CB(mainptr->camera.first);
00775     
00776     /* shapekeys */
00777     ANIMDATA_IDS_CB(mainptr->key.first);
00778     
00779     /* metaballs */
00780     ANIMDATA_IDS_CB(mainptr->mball.first);
00781     
00782     /* curves */
00783     ANIMDATA_IDS_CB(mainptr->curve.first);
00784     
00785     /* armatures */
00786     ANIMDATA_IDS_CB(mainptr->armature.first);
00787     
00788     /* lattices */
00789     ANIMDATA_IDS_CB(mainptr->latt.first);
00790     
00791     /* meshes */
00792     ANIMDATA_IDS_CB(mainptr->mesh.first);
00793     
00794     /* particles */
00795     ANIMDATA_IDS_CB(mainptr->particle.first);
00796 
00797     /* speakers */
00798     ANIMDATA_IDS_CB(mainptr->speaker.first);
00799 
00800     /* movie clips */
00801     ANIMDATA_IDS_CB(mainptr->movieclip.first);
00802 
00803     /* objects */
00804     ANIMDATA_IDS_CB(mainptr->object.first);
00805     
00806     /* worlds */
00807     ANIMDATA_IDS_CB(mainptr->world.first);
00808     
00809     /* scenes */
00810     ANIMDATA_NODETREE_IDS_CB(mainptr->scene.first, Scene);
00811 }
00812 
00813 /* Fix all RNA-Paths throughout the database (directly access the Global.main version)
00814  * NOTE: it is assumed that the structure we're replacing is <prefix><["><name><"]>
00815  *      i.e. pose.bones["Bone"]
00816  */
00817 /* TODO: use BKE_animdata_main_cb for looping over all data  */
00818 void BKE_all_animdata_fix_paths_rename(ID *ref_id, const char *prefix, const char *oldName, const char *newName)
00819 {
00820     Main *mainptr= G.main;
00821     ID *id;
00822     
00823     /* macro for less typing 
00824      *  - whether animdata exists is checked for by the main renaming callback, though taking 
00825      *    this outside of the function may make things slightly faster?
00826      */
00827 #define RENAMEFIX_ANIM_IDS(first) \
00828     for (id= first; id; id= id->next) { \
00829         AnimData *adt= BKE_animdata_from_id(id); \
00830         BKE_animdata_fix_paths_rename(id, adt, ref_id, prefix, oldName, newName, 0, 0, 1);\
00831     }
00832     
00833     /* another version of this macro for nodetrees */
00834 #define RENAMEFIX_ANIM_NODETREE_IDS(first, NtId_Type) \
00835     for (id= first; id; id= id->next) { \
00836         AnimData *adt= BKE_animdata_from_id(id); \
00837         NtId_Type *ntp= (NtId_Type *)id; \
00838         if (ntp->nodetree) { \
00839             AnimData *adt2= BKE_animdata_from_id((ID *)ntp); \
00840             BKE_animdata_fix_paths_rename((ID *)ntp, adt2, ref_id, prefix, oldName, newName, 0, 0, 1);\
00841         } \
00842         BKE_animdata_fix_paths_rename(id, adt, ref_id, prefix, oldName, newName, 0, 0, 1);\
00843     }
00844     
00845     /* nodes */
00846     RENAMEFIX_ANIM_IDS(mainptr->nodetree.first);
00847     
00848     /* textures */
00849     RENAMEFIX_ANIM_NODETREE_IDS(mainptr->tex.first, Tex);
00850     
00851     /* lamps */
00852     RENAMEFIX_ANIM_IDS(mainptr->lamp.first);
00853     
00854     /* materials */
00855     RENAMEFIX_ANIM_NODETREE_IDS(mainptr->mat.first, Material);
00856     
00857     /* cameras */
00858     RENAMEFIX_ANIM_IDS(mainptr->camera.first);
00859     
00860     /* shapekeys */
00861     RENAMEFIX_ANIM_IDS(mainptr->key.first);
00862     
00863     /* metaballs */
00864     RENAMEFIX_ANIM_IDS(mainptr->mball.first);
00865     
00866     /* curves */
00867     RENAMEFIX_ANIM_IDS(mainptr->curve.first);
00868     
00869     /* armatures */
00870     RENAMEFIX_ANIM_IDS(mainptr->armature.first);
00871     
00872     /* lattices */
00873     RENAMEFIX_ANIM_IDS(mainptr->latt.first);
00874     
00875     /* meshes */
00876     RENAMEFIX_ANIM_IDS(mainptr->mesh.first);
00877     
00878     /* particles */
00879     RENAMEFIX_ANIM_IDS(mainptr->particle.first);
00880 
00881     /* speakers */
00882     RENAMEFIX_ANIM_IDS(mainptr->speaker.first);
00883 
00884     /* movie clips */
00885     RENAMEFIX_ANIM_IDS(mainptr->movieclip.first);
00886 
00887     /* objects */
00888     RENAMEFIX_ANIM_IDS(mainptr->object.first); 
00889     
00890     /* worlds */
00891     RENAMEFIX_ANIM_IDS(mainptr->world.first);
00892     
00893     /* scenes */
00894     RENAMEFIX_ANIM_NODETREE_IDS(mainptr->scene.first, Scene);
00895 }
00896 
00897 /* *********************************** */ 
00898 /* KeyingSet API */
00899 
00900 /* Finding Tools --------------------------- */
00901 
00902 /* Find the first path that matches the given criteria */
00903 // TODO: do we want some method to perform partial matches too?
00904 KS_Path *BKE_keyingset_find_path (KeyingSet *ks, ID *id, const char group_name[], const char rna_path[], int array_index, int UNUSED(group_mode))
00905 {
00906     KS_Path *ksp;
00907     
00908     /* sanity checks */
00909     if (ELEM3(NULL, ks, rna_path, id))
00910         return NULL;
00911     
00912     /* loop over paths in the current KeyingSet, finding the first one where all settings match 
00913      * (i.e. the first one where none of the checks fail and equal 0)
00914      */
00915     for (ksp= ks->paths.first; ksp; ksp= ksp->next) {
00916         short eq_id=1, eq_path=1, eq_index=1, eq_group=1;
00917         
00918         /* id */
00919         if (id != ksp->id)
00920             eq_id= 0;
00921         
00922         /* path */
00923         if ((ksp->rna_path==NULL) || strcmp(rna_path, ksp->rna_path))
00924             eq_path= 0;
00925             
00926         /* index - need to compare whole-array setting too... */
00927         if (ksp->array_index != array_index)
00928             eq_index= 0;
00929             
00930         /* group */
00931         if (group_name) {
00932             // FIXME: these checks need to be coded... for now, it's not too important though
00933         }
00934             
00935         /* if all aspects are ok, return */
00936         if (eq_id && eq_path && eq_index && eq_group)
00937             return ksp;
00938     }
00939     
00940     /* none found */
00941     return NULL;
00942 }
00943  
00944 /* Defining Tools --------------------------- */
00945 
00946 /* Used to create a new 'custom' KeyingSet for the user, that will be automatically added to the stack */
00947 KeyingSet *BKE_keyingset_add (ListBase *list, const char idname[], const char name[], short flag, short keyingflag)
00948 {
00949     KeyingSet *ks;
00950     
00951     /* allocate new KeyingSet */
00952     ks= MEM_callocN(sizeof(KeyingSet), "KeyingSet");
00953 
00954     BLI_strncpy(ks->idname, idname ? idname : name ? name : "KeyingSet", sizeof(ks->idname));
00955 
00956     BLI_strncpy(ks->name, name ? name : idname ? idname : "Keying Set", sizeof(ks->name));
00957 
00958     ks->flag= flag;
00959     ks->keyingflag= keyingflag;
00960     
00961     /* add KeyingSet to list */
00962     BLI_addtail(list, ks);
00963     
00964     /* Make sure KeyingSet has a unique idname. */
00965     BLI_uniquename(list, ks, "KeyingSet", '.', offsetof(KeyingSet, idname), sizeof(ks->idname));
00966     
00967     /* Make sure KeyingSet has a unique label (this helps with identification). */
00968     BLI_uniquename(list, ks, "Keying Set", '.', offsetof(KeyingSet, name), sizeof(ks->name));
00969     
00970     /* return new KeyingSet for further editing */
00971     return ks;
00972 }
00973 
00974 /* Add a path to a KeyingSet. Nothing is returned for now...
00975  * Checks are performed to ensure that destination is appropriate for the KeyingSet in question
00976  */
00977 KS_Path *BKE_keyingset_add_path (KeyingSet *ks, ID *id, const char group_name[], const char rna_path[], int array_index, short flag, short groupmode)
00978 {
00979     KS_Path *ksp;
00980     
00981     /* sanity checks */
00982     if (ELEM(NULL, ks, rna_path)) {
00983         printf("ERROR: no Keying Set and/or RNA Path to add path with\n");
00984         return NULL;
00985     }
00986     
00987     /* ID is required for all types of KeyingSets */
00988     if (id == NULL) {
00989         printf("ERROR: No ID provided for Keying Set Path\n");
00990         return NULL;
00991     }
00992     
00993     /* don't add if there is already a matching KS_Path in the KeyingSet */
00994     if (BKE_keyingset_find_path(ks, id, group_name, rna_path, array_index, groupmode)) {
00995         if (G.debug & G_DEBUG)
00996             printf("ERROR: destination already exists in Keying Set\n");
00997         return NULL;
00998     }
00999     
01000     /* allocate a new KeyingSet Path */
01001     ksp= MEM_callocN(sizeof(KS_Path), "KeyingSet Path");
01002     
01003     /* just store absolute info */
01004     ksp->id= id;
01005     if (group_name)
01006         BLI_strncpy(ksp->group, group_name, sizeof(ksp->group));
01007     else
01008         ksp->group[0]= '\0';
01009     
01010     /* store additional info for relative paths (just in case user makes the set relative) */
01011     if (id)
01012         ksp->idtype= GS(id->name);
01013     
01014     /* just copy path info */
01015     // TODO: should array index be checked too?
01016     ksp->rna_path= BLI_strdupn(rna_path, strlen(rna_path));
01017     ksp->array_index= array_index;
01018     
01019     /* store flags */
01020     ksp->flag= flag;
01021     ksp->groupmode= groupmode;
01022     
01023     /* add KeyingSet path to KeyingSet */
01024     BLI_addtail(&ks->paths, ksp);
01025     
01026     /* return this path */
01027     return ksp;
01028 }   
01029 
01030 /* Free the given Keying Set path */
01031 void BKE_keyingset_free_path (KeyingSet *ks, KS_Path *ksp)
01032 {
01033     /* sanity check */
01034     if (ELEM(NULL, ks, ksp))
01035         return;
01036 
01037     /* free RNA-path info */
01038     if (ksp->rna_path)
01039         MEM_freeN(ksp->rna_path);
01040 
01041     /* free path itself */
01042     BLI_freelinkN(&ks->paths, ksp);
01043 }
01044 
01045 /* Copy all KeyingSets in the given list */
01046 void BKE_keyingsets_copy (ListBase *newlist, ListBase *list)
01047 {
01048     KeyingSet *ksn;
01049     KS_Path *kspn;
01050     
01051     BLI_duplicatelist(newlist, list);
01052 
01053     for (ksn=newlist->first; ksn; ksn=ksn->next) {
01054         BLI_duplicatelist(&ksn->paths, &ksn->paths);
01055         
01056         for (kspn=ksn->paths.first; kspn; kspn=kspn->next)
01057             kspn->rna_path= MEM_dupallocN(kspn->rna_path);
01058     }
01059 }
01060 
01061 /* Freeing Tools --------------------------- */
01062 
01063 /* Free data for KeyingSet but not set itself */
01064 void BKE_keyingset_free (KeyingSet *ks)
01065 {
01066     KS_Path *ksp, *kspn;
01067     
01068     /* sanity check */
01069     if (ks == NULL)
01070         return;
01071     
01072     /* free each path as we go to avoid looping twice */
01073     for (ksp= ks->paths.first; ksp; ksp= kspn) {
01074         kspn= ksp->next;
01075         BKE_keyingset_free_path(ks, ksp);
01076     }
01077 }
01078 
01079 /* Free all the KeyingSets in the given list */
01080 void BKE_keyingsets_free (ListBase *list)
01081 {
01082     KeyingSet *ks, *ksn;
01083     
01084     /* sanity check */
01085     if (list == NULL)
01086         return;
01087     
01088     /* loop over KeyingSets freeing them 
01089      *  - BKE_keyingset_free() doesn't free the set itself, but it frees its sub-data
01090      */
01091     for (ks= list->first; ks; ks= ksn) {
01092         ksn= ks->next;
01093         BKE_keyingset_free(ks);
01094         BLI_freelinkN(list, ks);
01095     }
01096 }
01097 
01098 /* ***************************************** */
01099 /* Evaluation Data-Setting Backend */
01100 
01101 /* Retrieve string to act as RNA-path, adjusted using mapping-table if provided 
01102  * It returns whether the string needs to be freed (i.e. if it was a temp remapped one)
01103  * // FIXME: maybe it would be faster if we didn't have to alloc/free strings like this all the time, but for now it's safer
01104  *
01105  *  - remap: remapping table to use
01106  *  - path: original path string (as stored in F-Curve data)
01107  *  - dst: destination string to write data to
01108  */
01109 static short animsys_remap_path (AnimMapper *UNUSED(remap), char *path, char **dst)
01110 {
01111     /* is there a valid remapping table to use? */
01112     //if (remap) {
01113         /* find a matching entry... to use to remap */
01114         // ...TODO...
01115     //}
01116     
01117     /* nothing suitable found, so just set dst to look at path (i.e. no alloc/free needed) */
01118     *dst= path;
01119     return 0;
01120 }
01121 
01122 
01123 /* less then 1.0 evaluates to false, use epsilon to avoid float error */
01124 #define ANIMSYS_FLOAT_AS_BOOL(value) ((value) > ((1.0f-FLT_EPSILON)))
01125 
01126 /* Write the given value to a setting using RNA, and return success */
01127 static short animsys_write_rna_setting (PointerRNA *ptr, char *path, int array_index, float value)
01128 {
01129     PropertyRNA *prop;
01130     PointerRNA new_ptr;
01131     
01132     //printf("%p %s %i %f\n", ptr, path, array_index, value);
01133     
01134     /* get property to write to */
01135     if (RNA_path_resolve(ptr, path, &new_ptr, &prop)) {
01136         /* set value - only for animatable numerical values */
01137         if (RNA_property_animateable(&new_ptr, prop)) {
01138             int array_len= RNA_property_array_length(&new_ptr, prop);
01139             
01140             if (array_len && array_index >= array_len) {
01141                 if (G.debug & G_DEBUG) {
01142                     printf("Animato: Invalid array index. ID = '%s',  '%s[%d]', array length is %d\n",
01143                         (ptr && ptr->id.data) ? (((ID *)ptr->id.data)->name+2) : "<No ID>",
01144                         path, array_index, array_len-1);
01145                 }
01146                 
01147                 return 0;
01148             }
01149             
01150             switch (RNA_property_type(prop)) {
01151                 case PROP_BOOLEAN:
01152                     if (array_len)
01153                         RNA_property_boolean_set_index(&new_ptr, prop, array_index, ANIMSYS_FLOAT_AS_BOOL(value));
01154                     else
01155                         RNA_property_boolean_set(&new_ptr, prop, ANIMSYS_FLOAT_AS_BOOL(value));
01156                     break;
01157                 case PROP_INT:
01158                     if (array_len)
01159                         RNA_property_int_set_index(&new_ptr, prop, array_index, (int)value);
01160                     else
01161                         RNA_property_int_set(&new_ptr, prop, (int)value);
01162                     break;
01163                 case PROP_FLOAT:
01164                     if (array_len)
01165                         RNA_property_float_set_index(&new_ptr, prop, array_index, value);
01166                     else
01167                         RNA_property_float_set(&new_ptr, prop, value);
01168                     break;
01169                 case PROP_ENUM:
01170                     RNA_property_enum_set(&new_ptr, prop, (int)value);
01171                     break;
01172                 default:
01173                     /* nothing can be done here... so it is unsuccessful? */
01174                     return 0;
01175             }
01176             
01177             /* RNA property update disabled for now - [#28525] [#28690] [#28774] [#28777] */
01178 #if 0
01179             /* buffer property update for later flushing */
01180             if (RNA_property_update_check(prop)) {
01181                 short skip_updates_hack = 0;
01182                 
01183                 /* optimization hacks: skip property updates for those properties
01184                  * for we know that which the updates in RNA were really just for
01185                  * flushing property editing via UI/Py
01186                  */
01187                 if (new_ptr.type == &RNA_PoseBone) {
01188                     /* bone transforms - update pose (i.e. tag depsgraph) */
01189                     skip_updates_hack = 1;
01190                 }               
01191                 
01192                 if (skip_updates_hack == 0)
01193                     RNA_property_update_cache_add(&new_ptr, prop);
01194             }
01195 #endif
01196 
01197             /* as long as we don't do property update, we still tag datablock
01198              * as having been updated. this flag does not cause any updates to
01199              * be run, it's for e.g. render engines to synchronize data */
01200             if (new_ptr.id.data) {
01201                 ID *id= new_ptr.id.data;
01202                 id->flag |= LIB_ID_RECALC;
01203                 DAG_id_type_tag(G.main, GS(id->name));
01204             }
01205         }
01206         
01207         /* successful */
01208         return 1;
01209     }
01210     else {
01211         /* failed to get path */
01212         // XXX don't tag as failed yet though, as there are some legit situations (Action Constraint) 
01213         // where some channels will not exist, but shouldn't lock up Action
01214         if (G.debug & G_DEBUG) {
01215             printf("Animato: Invalid path. ID = '%s',  '%s[%d]'\n",
01216                 (ptr && ptr->id.data) ? (((ID *)ptr->id.data)->name+2) : "<No ID>", 
01217                 path, array_index);
01218         }
01219         return 0;
01220     }
01221 }
01222 
01223 /* Simple replacement based data-setting of the FCurve using RNA */
01224 static short animsys_execute_fcurve (PointerRNA *ptr, AnimMapper *remap, FCurve *fcu)
01225 {
01226     char *path = NULL;
01227     short free_path=0;
01228     short ok= 0;
01229     
01230     /* get path, remapped as appropriate to work in its new environment */
01231     free_path= animsys_remap_path(remap, fcu->rna_path, &path);
01232     
01233     /* write value to setting */
01234     if (path)
01235         ok= animsys_write_rna_setting(ptr, path, fcu->array_index, fcu->curval);
01236     
01237     /* free temp path-info */
01238     if (free_path)
01239         MEM_freeN(path);
01240         
01241     /* return whether we were successful */
01242     return ok;
01243 }
01244 
01245 /* Evaluate all the F-Curves in the given list 
01246  * This performs a set of standard checks. If extra checks are required, separate code should be used
01247  */
01248 static void animsys_evaluate_fcurves (PointerRNA *ptr, ListBase *list, AnimMapper *remap, float ctime)
01249 {
01250     FCurve *fcu;
01251     
01252     /* calculate then execute each curve */
01253     for (fcu= list->first; fcu; fcu= fcu->next) 
01254     {
01255         /* check if this F-Curve doesn't belong to a muted group */
01256         if ((fcu->grp == NULL) || (fcu->grp->flag & AGRP_MUTED)==0) {
01257             /* check if this curve should be skipped */
01258             if ((fcu->flag & (FCURVE_MUTED|FCURVE_DISABLED)) == 0) {
01259                 calculate_fcurve(fcu, ctime);
01260                 animsys_execute_fcurve(ptr, remap, fcu); 
01261             }
01262         }
01263     }
01264 }
01265 
01266 /* ***************************************** */
01267 /* Driver Evaluation */
01268 
01269 /* Evaluate Drivers */
01270 static void animsys_evaluate_drivers (PointerRNA *ptr, AnimData *adt, float ctime)
01271 {
01272     FCurve *fcu;
01273     
01274     /* drivers are stored as F-Curves, but we cannot use the standard code, as we need to check if
01275      * the depsgraph requested that this driver be evaluated...
01276      */
01277     for (fcu= adt->drivers.first; fcu; fcu= fcu->next) 
01278     {
01279         ChannelDriver *driver= fcu->driver;
01280         short ok= 0;
01281         
01282         /* check if this driver's curve should be skipped */
01283         if ((fcu->flag & (FCURVE_MUTED|FCURVE_DISABLED)) == 0) {
01284             /* check if driver itself is tagged for recalculation */
01285             if ((driver) && !(driver->flag & DRIVER_FLAG_INVALID)/*&& (driver->flag & DRIVER_FLAG_RECALC)*/) {  // XXX driver recalc flag is not set yet by depsgraph!
01286                 /* evaluate this using values set already in other places */
01287                 // NOTE: for 'layering' option later on, we should check if we should remove old value before adding new to only be done when drivers only changed
01288                 calculate_fcurve(fcu, ctime);
01289                 ok= animsys_execute_fcurve(ptr, NULL, fcu);
01290                 
01291                 /* clear recalc flag */
01292                 driver->flag &= ~DRIVER_FLAG_RECALC;
01293                 
01294                 /* set error-flag if evaluation failed */
01295                 if (ok == 0)
01296                     driver->flag |= DRIVER_FLAG_INVALID; 
01297             }
01298         }
01299     }
01300 }
01301 
01302 /* ***************************************** */
01303 /* Actions Evaluation */
01304 
01305 /* strictly not necessary for actual "evaluation", but it is a useful safety check
01306  * to reduce the amount of times that users end up having to "revive" wrongly-assigned
01307  * actions
01308  */
01309 static void action_idcode_patch_check (ID *id, bAction *act)
01310 {
01311     int idcode = 0;
01312     
01313     /* just in case */
01314     if (ELEM(NULL, id, act))
01315         return;
01316     else
01317         idcode = GS(id->name);
01318     
01319     /* the actual checks... hopefully not too much of a performance hit in the long run... */
01320     if (act->idroot == 0) {
01321         /* use the current root if not set already (i.e. newly created actions and actions from 2.50-2.57 builds)
01322          *  - this has problems if there are 2 users, and the first one encountered is the invalid one
01323          *    in which case, the user will need to manually fix this (?)
01324          */
01325         act->idroot = idcode;
01326     }
01327     else if (act->idroot != idcode) {
01328         /* only report this error if debug mode is enabled (to save performance everywhere else) */
01329         if (G.debug & G_DEBUG) {
01330             printf("AnimSys Safety Check Failed: Action '%s' is not meant to be used from ID-Blocks of type %d such as '%s'\n",
01331                 act->id.name+2, idcode, id->name);
01332         }
01333     }
01334 }
01335 
01336 /* ----------------------------------------- */
01337 
01338 /* Evaluate Action Group */
01339 void animsys_evaluate_action_group (PointerRNA *ptr, bAction *act, bActionGroup *agrp, AnimMapper *remap, float ctime)
01340 {
01341     FCurve *fcu;
01342     
01343     /* check if mapper is appropriate for use here (we set to NULL if it's inappropriate) */
01344     if (ELEM(NULL, act, agrp)) return;
01345     if ((remap) && (remap->target != act)) remap= NULL;
01346     
01347     action_idcode_patch_check(ptr->id.data, act);
01348     
01349     /* if group is muted, don't evaluated any of the F-Curve */
01350     if (agrp->flag & AGRP_MUTED)
01351         return;
01352     
01353     /* calculate then execute each curve */
01354     for (fcu= agrp->channels.first; (fcu) && (fcu->grp == agrp); fcu= fcu->next) 
01355     {
01356         /* check if this curve should be skipped */
01357         if ((fcu->flag & (FCURVE_MUTED|FCURVE_DISABLED)) == 0) {
01358             calculate_fcurve(fcu, ctime);
01359             animsys_execute_fcurve(ptr, remap, fcu); 
01360         }
01361     }
01362 }
01363 
01364 /* Evaluate Action (F-Curve Bag) */
01365 void animsys_evaluate_action (PointerRNA *ptr, bAction *act, AnimMapper *remap, float ctime)
01366 {
01367     /* check if mapper is appropriate for use here (we set to NULL if it's inappropriate) */
01368     if (act == NULL) return;
01369     if ((remap) && (remap->target != act)) remap= NULL;
01370     
01371     action_idcode_patch_check(ptr->id.data, act);
01372     
01373     /* calculate then execute each curve */
01374     animsys_evaluate_fcurves(ptr, &act->curves, remap, ctime);
01375 }
01376 
01377 /* ***************************************** */
01378 /* NLA System - Evaluation */
01379 
01380 /* calculate influence of strip based for given frame based on blendin/out values */
01381 static float nlastrip_get_influence (NlaStrip *strip, float cframe)
01382 {
01383     /* sanity checks - normalize the blendin/out values? */
01384     strip->blendin= fabsf(strip->blendin);
01385     strip->blendout= fabsf(strip->blendout);
01386     
01387     /* result depends on where frame is in respect to blendin/out values */
01388     if (IS_EQ(strip->blendin, 0)==0 && (cframe <= (strip->start + strip->blendin))) {
01389         /* there is some blend-in */
01390         return fabsf(cframe - strip->start) / (strip->blendin);
01391     }
01392     else if (IS_EQ(strip->blendout, 0)==0 && (cframe >= (strip->end - strip->blendout))) {
01393         /* there is some blend-out */
01394         return fabsf(strip->end - cframe) / (strip->blendout);
01395     }
01396     else {
01397         /* in the middle of the strip, we should be full strength */
01398         return 1.0f;
01399     }
01400 }
01401 
01402 /* evaluate the evaluation time and influence for the strip, storing the results in the strip */
01403 static void nlastrip_evaluate_controls (NlaStrip *strip, float ctime)
01404 {
01405     /* firstly, analytically generate values for influence and time (if applicable) */
01406     if ((strip->flag & NLASTRIP_FLAG_USR_TIME) == 0)
01407         strip->strip_time= nlastrip_get_frame(strip, ctime, NLATIME_CONVERT_EVAL);
01408     if ((strip->flag & NLASTRIP_FLAG_USR_INFLUENCE) == 0)
01409         strip->influence= nlastrip_get_influence(strip, ctime);
01410     
01411     /* now strip's evaluate F-Curves for these settings (if applicable) */
01412     if (strip->fcurves.first) {
01413         PointerRNA strip_ptr;
01414         
01415         /* create RNA-pointer needed to set values */
01416         RNA_pointer_create(NULL, &RNA_NlaStrip, strip, &strip_ptr);
01417         
01418         /* execute these settings as per normal */
01419         animsys_evaluate_fcurves(&strip_ptr, &strip->fcurves, NULL, ctime);
01420     }
01421 
01422     /* if user can control the evaluation time (using F-Curves), consider the option which allows this time to be clamped 
01423      * to lie within extents of the action-clip, so that a steady changing rate of progress through several cycles of the clip
01424      * can be achieved easily
01425      */
01426     // NOTE: if we add any more of these special cases, we better group them up nicely...
01427     if ((strip->flag & NLASTRIP_FLAG_USR_TIME) && (strip->flag & NLASTRIP_FLAG_USR_TIME_CYCLIC))
01428         strip->strip_time= fmod(strip->strip_time - strip->actstart, strip->actend - strip->actstart);
01429 }
01430 
01431 /* gets the strip active at the current time for a list of strips for evaluation purposes */
01432 NlaEvalStrip *nlastrips_ctime_get_strip (ListBase *list, ListBase *strips, short index, float ctime)
01433 {
01434     NlaStrip *strip, *estrip=NULL;
01435     NlaEvalStrip *nes;
01436     short side= 0;
01437     
01438     /* loop over strips, checking if they fall within the range */
01439     for (strip= strips->first; strip; strip= strip->next) {
01440         /* check if current time occurs within this strip  */
01441         if (IN_RANGE_INCL(ctime, strip->start, strip->end)) {
01442             /* this strip is active, so try to use it */
01443             estrip= strip;
01444             side= NES_TIME_WITHIN;
01445             break;
01446         }
01447         
01448         /* if time occurred before current strip... */
01449         if (ctime < strip->start) {
01450             if (strip == strips->first) {
01451                 /* before first strip - only try to use it if it extends backwards in time too */
01452                 if (strip->extendmode == NLASTRIP_EXTEND_HOLD)
01453                     estrip= strip;
01454                     
01455                 /* side is 'before' regardless of whether there's a useful strip */
01456                 side= NES_TIME_BEFORE;
01457             }
01458             else {
01459                 /* before next strip - previous strip has ended, but next hasn't begun, 
01460                  * so blending mode depends on whether strip is being held or not...
01461                  *  - only occurs when no transition strip added, otherwise the transition would have
01462                  *    been picked up above...
01463                  */
01464                 strip= strip->prev;
01465                 
01466                 if (strip->extendmode != NLASTRIP_EXTEND_NOTHING)
01467                     estrip= strip;
01468                 side= NES_TIME_AFTER;
01469             }
01470             break;
01471         }
01472         
01473         /* if time occurred after current strip... */
01474         if (ctime > strip->end) {
01475             /* only if this is the last strip should we do anything, and only if that is being held */
01476             if (strip == strips->last) {
01477                 if (strip->extendmode != NLASTRIP_EXTEND_NOTHING)
01478                     estrip= strip;
01479                     
01480                 side= NES_TIME_AFTER;
01481                 break;
01482             }
01483             
01484             /* otherwise, skip... as the 'before' case will catch it more elegantly! */
01485         }
01486     }
01487     
01488     /* check if a valid strip was found
01489      *  - must not be muted (i.e. will have contribution
01490      */
01491     if ((estrip == NULL) || (estrip->flag & NLASTRIP_FLAG_MUTED)) 
01492         return NULL;
01493         
01494     /* if ctime was not within the boundaries of the strip, clamp! */
01495     switch (side) {
01496         case NES_TIME_BEFORE: /* extend first frame only */
01497             ctime= estrip->start;
01498             break;
01499         case NES_TIME_AFTER: /* extend last frame only */
01500             ctime= estrip->end;
01501             break;
01502     }
01503     
01504     /* evaluate strip's evaluation controls  
01505      *  - skip if no influence (i.e. same effect as muting the strip)
01506      *  - negative influence is not supported yet... how would that be defined?
01507      */
01508     // TODO: this sounds a bit hacky having a few isolated F-Curves stuck on some data it operates on...
01509     nlastrip_evaluate_controls(estrip, ctime);
01510     if (estrip->influence <= 0.0f)
01511         return NULL;
01512         
01513     /* check if strip has valid data to evaluate,
01514      * and/or perform any additional type-specific actions
01515      */
01516     switch (estrip->type) {
01517         case NLASTRIP_TYPE_CLIP: 
01518             /* clip must have some action to evaluate */
01519             if (estrip->act == NULL)
01520                 return NULL;
01521             break;
01522         case NLASTRIP_TYPE_TRANSITION:
01523             /* there must be strips to transition from and to (i.e. prev and next required) */
01524             if (ELEM(NULL, estrip->prev, estrip->next))
01525                 return NULL;
01526                 
01527             /* evaluate controls for the relevant extents of the bordering strips... */
01528             nlastrip_evaluate_controls(estrip->prev, estrip->start);
01529             nlastrip_evaluate_controls(estrip->next, estrip->end);
01530             break;
01531     }
01532     
01533     /* add to list of strips we need to evaluate */
01534     nes= MEM_callocN(sizeof(NlaEvalStrip), "NlaEvalStrip");
01535     
01536     nes->strip= estrip;
01537     nes->strip_mode= side;
01538     nes->track_index= index;
01539     nes->strip_time= estrip->strip_time;
01540     
01541     if (list)
01542         BLI_addtail(list, nes);
01543     
01544     return nes;
01545 }
01546 
01547 /* ---------------------- */
01548 
01549 /* find an NlaEvalChannel that matches the given criteria 
01550  *  - ptr and prop are the RNA data to find a match for
01551  */
01552 static NlaEvalChannel *nlaevalchan_find_match (ListBase *channels, PointerRNA *ptr, PropertyRNA *prop, int array_index)
01553 {
01554     NlaEvalChannel *nec;
01555     
01556     /* sanity check */
01557     if (channels == NULL)
01558         return NULL;
01559     
01560     /* loop through existing channels, checking for a channel which affects the same property */
01561     for (nec= channels->first; nec; nec= nec->next) {
01562         /* - comparing the PointerRNA's is done by comparing the pointers
01563          *   to the actual struct the property resides in, since that all the
01564          *   other data stored in PointerRNA cannot allow us to definitively 
01565          *  identify the data 
01566          */
01567         if ((nec->ptr.data == ptr->data) && (nec->prop == prop) && (nec->index == array_index))
01568             return nec;
01569     }
01570     
01571     /* not found */
01572     return NULL;
01573 }
01574 
01575 /* verify that an appropriate NlaEvalChannel for this F-Curve exists */
01576 static NlaEvalChannel *nlaevalchan_verify (PointerRNA *ptr, ListBase *channels, NlaEvalStrip *nes, FCurve *fcu, short *newChan)
01577 {
01578     NlaEvalChannel *nec;
01579     NlaStrip *strip= nes->strip;
01580     PropertyRNA *prop;
01581     PointerRNA new_ptr;
01582     char *path = NULL;
01583     /* short free_path=0; */
01584     
01585     /* sanity checks */
01586     if (channels == NULL)
01587         return NULL;
01588     
01589     /* get RNA pointer+property info from F-Curve for more convenient handling */
01590         /* get path, remapped as appropriate to work in its new environment */
01591     /* free_path= */ /* UNUSED */ animsys_remap_path(strip->remap, fcu->rna_path, &path);
01592     
01593         /* a valid property must be available, and it must be animatable */
01594     if (RNA_path_resolve(ptr, path, &new_ptr, &prop) == 0) {
01595         if (G.debug & G_DEBUG) printf("NLA Strip Eval: Cannot resolve path\n");
01596         return NULL;
01597     }
01598         /* only ok if animatable */
01599     else if (RNA_property_animateable(&new_ptr, prop) == 0) {
01600         if (G.debug & G_DEBUG) printf("NLA Strip Eval: Property not animatable\n");
01601         return NULL;
01602     }
01603     
01604     /* try to find a match */
01605     nec= nlaevalchan_find_match(channels, &new_ptr, prop, fcu->array_index);
01606     
01607     /* allocate a new struct for this if none found */
01608     if (nec == NULL) {
01609         nec= MEM_callocN(sizeof(NlaEvalChannel), "NlaEvalChannel");
01610         *newChan= 1;
01611         BLI_addtail(channels, nec);
01612         
01613         nec->ptr= new_ptr; 
01614         nec->prop= prop;
01615         nec->index= fcu->array_index;
01616     }
01617     else
01618         *newChan= 0;
01619     
01620     /* we can now return */
01621     return nec;
01622 }
01623 
01624 /* accumulate (i.e. blend) the given value on to the channel it affects */
01625 static void nlaevalchan_accumulate (NlaEvalChannel *nec, NlaEvalStrip *nes, short newChan, float value)
01626 {
01627     NlaStrip *strip= nes->strip;
01628     short blendmode= strip->blendmode;
01629     float inf= strip->influence;
01630     
01631     /* if channel is new, just store value regardless of blending factors, etc. */
01632     if (newChan) {
01633         nec->value= value;
01634         return;
01635     }
01636         
01637     /* if this is being performed as part of transition evaluation, incorporate
01638      * an additional weighting factor for the influence
01639      */
01640     if (nes->strip_mode == NES_TIME_TRANSITION_END) 
01641         inf *= nes->strip_time;
01642     
01643     /* premultiply the value by the weighting factor */
01644     if (IS_EQ(inf, 0)) return;
01645     value *= inf;
01646     
01647     /* perform blending */
01648     switch (blendmode) {
01649         case NLASTRIP_MODE_ADD:
01650             /* simply add the scaled value on to the stack */
01651             nec->value += value;
01652             break;
01653             
01654         case NLASTRIP_MODE_SUBTRACT:
01655             /* simply subtract the scaled value from the stack */
01656             nec->value -= value;
01657             break;
01658             
01659         case NLASTRIP_MODE_MULTIPLY:
01660             /* multiply the scaled value with the stack */
01661             nec->value *= value;
01662             break;
01663         
01664         case NLASTRIP_MODE_REPLACE:
01665         default: // TODO: do we really want to blend by default? it seems more uses might prefer add...
01666             /* do linear interpolation 
01667              *  - the influence of the accumulated data (elsewhere, that is called dstweight) 
01668              *    is 1 - influence, since the strip's influence is srcweight
01669              */
01670             nec->value= nec->value * (1.0f - inf)   +   value;
01671             break;
01672     }
01673 }
01674 
01675 /* accumulate the results of a temporary buffer with the results of the full-buffer */
01676 static void nlaevalchan_buffers_accumulate (ListBase *channels, ListBase *tmp_buffer, NlaEvalStrip *nes)
01677 {
01678     NlaEvalChannel *nec, *necn, *necd;
01679     
01680     /* optimize - abort if no channels */
01681     if (tmp_buffer->first == NULL)
01682         return;
01683     
01684     /* accumulate results in tmp_channels buffer to the accumulation buffer */
01685     for (nec= tmp_buffer->first; nec; nec= necn) {
01686         /* get pointer to next channel in case we remove the current channel from the temp-buffer */
01687         necn= nec->next;
01688         
01689         /* try to find an existing matching channel for this setting in the accumulation buffer */
01690         necd= nlaevalchan_find_match(channels, &nec->ptr, nec->prop, nec->index);
01691         
01692         /* if there was a matching channel already in the buffer, accumulate to it,
01693          * otherwise, add the current channel to the buffer for efficiency
01694          */
01695         if (necd)
01696             nlaevalchan_accumulate(necd, nes, 0, nec->value);
01697         else {
01698             BLI_remlink(tmp_buffer, nec);
01699             BLI_addtail(channels, nec);
01700         }
01701     }
01702     
01703     /* free temp-channels that haven't been assimilated into the buffer */
01704     BLI_freelistN(tmp_buffer);
01705 }
01706 
01707 /* ---------------------- */
01708 /* F-Modifier stack joining/separation utilities - should we generalise these for BLI_listbase.h interface? */
01709 
01710 /* Temporarily join two lists of modifiers together, storing the result in a third list */
01711 static void nlaeval_fmodifiers_join_stacks (ListBase *result, ListBase *list1, ListBase *list2)
01712 {
01713     FModifier *fcm1, *fcm2;
01714     
01715     /* if list1 is invalid...  */
01716     if (ELEM(NULL, list1, list1->first)) {
01717         if (list2 && list2->first) {
01718             result->first= list2->first;
01719             result->last= list2->last;
01720         }
01721     }
01722     /* if list 2 is invalid... */
01723     else if (ELEM(NULL, list2, list2->first)) {
01724         result->first= list1->first;
01725         result->last= list1->last;
01726     }
01727     else {
01728         /* list1 should be added first, and list2 second, with the endpoints of these being the endpoints for result 
01729          *  - the original lists must be left unchanged though, as we need that fact for restoring
01730          */
01731         result->first= list1->first;
01732         result->last= list2->last;
01733         
01734         fcm1= list1->last;
01735         fcm2= list2->first;
01736         
01737         fcm1->next= fcm2;
01738         fcm2->prev= fcm1;
01739     }
01740 }
01741 
01742 /* Split two temporary lists of modifiers */
01743 static void nlaeval_fmodifiers_split_stacks (ListBase *list1, ListBase *list2)
01744 {
01745     FModifier *fcm1, *fcm2;
01746     
01747     /* if list1/2 is invalid... just skip */
01748     if (ELEM(NULL, list1, list2))
01749         return;
01750     if (ELEM(NULL, list1->first, list2->first))
01751         return;
01752         
01753     /* get endpoints */
01754     fcm1= list1->last;
01755     fcm2= list2->first;
01756     
01757     /* clear their links */
01758     fcm1->next= NULL;
01759     fcm2->prev= NULL;
01760 }
01761 
01762 /* ---------------------- */
01763 
01764 /* evaluate action-clip strip */
01765 static void nlastrip_evaluate_actionclip (PointerRNA *ptr, ListBase *channels, ListBase *modifiers, NlaEvalStrip *nes)
01766 {
01767     ListBase tmp_modifiers = {NULL, NULL};
01768     NlaStrip *strip= nes->strip;
01769     FCurve *fcu;
01770     float evaltime;
01771     
01772     /* sanity checks for action */
01773     if (strip == NULL)
01774         return;
01775         
01776     if (strip->act == NULL) {
01777         printf("NLA-Strip Eval Error: Strip '%s' has no Action\n", strip->name);
01778         return;
01779     }
01780     
01781     action_idcode_patch_check(ptr->id.data, strip->act);
01782     
01783     /* join this strip's modifiers to the parent's modifiers (own modifiers first) */
01784     nlaeval_fmodifiers_join_stacks(&tmp_modifiers, &strip->modifiers, modifiers);
01785     
01786     /* evaluate strip's modifiers which modify time to evaluate the base curves at */
01787     evaltime= evaluate_time_fmodifiers(&tmp_modifiers, NULL, 0.0f, strip->strip_time);
01788     
01789     /* evaluate all the F-Curves in the action, saving the relevant pointers to data that will need to be used */
01790     for (fcu= strip->act->curves.first; fcu; fcu= fcu->next) {
01791         NlaEvalChannel *nec;
01792         float value = 0.0f;
01793         short newChan = -1;
01794         
01795         /* check if this curve should be skipped */
01796         if (fcu->flag & (FCURVE_MUTED|FCURVE_DISABLED)) 
01797             continue;
01798         if ((fcu->grp) && (fcu->grp->flag & AGRP_MUTED))
01799             continue;
01800             
01801         /* evaluate the F-Curve's value for the time given in the strip 
01802          * NOTE: we use the modified time here, since strip's F-Curve Modifiers are applied on top of this 
01803          */
01804         value= evaluate_fcurve(fcu, evaltime);
01805         
01806         /* apply strip's F-Curve Modifiers on this value 
01807          * NOTE: we apply the strip's original evaluation time not the modified one (as per standard F-Curve eval)
01808          */
01809         evaluate_value_fmodifiers(&tmp_modifiers, fcu, &value, strip->strip_time);
01810         
01811         
01812         /* get an NLA evaluation channel to work with, and accumulate the evaluated value with the value(s)
01813          * stored in this channel if it has been used already
01814          */
01815         nec= nlaevalchan_verify(ptr, channels, nes, fcu, &newChan);
01816         if (nec)
01817             nlaevalchan_accumulate(nec, nes, newChan, value);
01818     }
01819     
01820     /* unlink this strip's modifiers from the parent's modifiers again */
01821     nlaeval_fmodifiers_split_stacks(&strip->modifiers, modifiers);
01822 }
01823 
01824 /* evaluate transition strip */
01825 static void nlastrip_evaluate_transition (PointerRNA *ptr, ListBase *channels, ListBase *modifiers, NlaEvalStrip *nes)
01826 {
01827     ListBase tmp_channels = {NULL, NULL};
01828     ListBase tmp_modifiers = {NULL, NULL};
01829     NlaEvalStrip tmp_nes;
01830     NlaStrip *s1, *s2;
01831     
01832     /* join this strip's modifiers to the parent's modifiers (own modifiers first) */
01833     nlaeval_fmodifiers_join_stacks(&tmp_modifiers, &nes->strip->modifiers, modifiers);
01834     
01835     /* get the two strips to operate on 
01836      *  - we use the endpoints of the strips directly flanking our strip
01837      *    using these as the endpoints of the transition (destination and source)
01838      *  - these should have already been determined to be valid...
01839      *  - if this strip is being played in reverse, we need to swap these endpoints
01840      *    otherwise they will be interpolated wrong
01841      */
01842     if (nes->strip->flag & NLASTRIP_FLAG_REVERSE) {
01843         s1= nes->strip->next;
01844         s2= nes->strip->prev;
01845     }
01846     else {
01847         s1= nes->strip->prev;
01848         s2= nes->strip->next;
01849     }
01850     
01851     /* prepare template for 'evaluation strip' 
01852      *  - based on the transition strip's evaluation strip data
01853      *  - strip_mode is NES_TIME_TRANSITION_* based on which endpoint
01854      *  - strip_time is the 'normalised' (i.e. in-strip) time for evaluation,
01855      *    which doubles up as an additional weighting factor for the strip influences
01856      *    which allows us to appear to be 'interpolating' between the two extremes
01857      */
01858     tmp_nes= *nes;
01859     
01860     /* evaluate these strips into a temp-buffer (tmp_channels) */
01861     // FIXME: modifier evalation here needs some work...
01862         /* first strip */
01863     tmp_nes.strip_mode= NES_TIME_TRANSITION_START;
01864     tmp_nes.strip= s1;
01865     nlastrip_evaluate(ptr, &tmp_channels, &tmp_modifiers, &tmp_nes);
01866     
01867         /* second strip */
01868     tmp_nes.strip_mode= NES_TIME_TRANSITION_END;
01869     tmp_nes.strip= s2;
01870     nlastrip_evaluate(ptr, &tmp_channels, &tmp_modifiers, &tmp_nes);
01871     
01872     
01873     /* assumulate temp-buffer and full-buffer, using the 'real' strip */
01874     nlaevalchan_buffers_accumulate(channels, &tmp_channels, nes);
01875     
01876     /* unlink this strip's modifiers from the parent's modifiers again */
01877     nlaeval_fmodifiers_split_stacks(&nes->strip->modifiers, modifiers);
01878 }
01879 
01880 /* evaluate meta-strip */
01881 static void nlastrip_evaluate_meta (PointerRNA *ptr, ListBase *channels, ListBase *modifiers, NlaEvalStrip *nes)
01882 {
01883     ListBase tmp_channels = {NULL, NULL};
01884     ListBase tmp_modifiers = {NULL, NULL};
01885     NlaStrip *strip= nes->strip;
01886     NlaEvalStrip *tmp_nes;
01887     float evaltime;
01888     
01889     /* meta-strip was calculated normally to have some time to be evaluated at
01890      * and here we 'look inside' the meta strip, treating it as a decorated window to
01891      * it's child strips, which get evaluated as if they were some tracks on a strip 
01892      * (but with some extra modifiers to apply).
01893      *
01894      * NOTE: keep this in sync with animsys_evaluate_nla()
01895      */
01896      
01897     /* join this strip's modifiers to the parent's modifiers (own modifiers first) */
01898     nlaeval_fmodifiers_join_stacks(&tmp_modifiers, &strip->modifiers, modifiers); 
01899     
01900     /* find the child-strip to evaluate */
01901     evaltime= (nes->strip_time * (strip->end - strip->start)) + strip->start;
01902     tmp_nes= nlastrips_ctime_get_strip(NULL, &strip->strips, -1, evaltime);
01903     if (tmp_nes == NULL)
01904         return;
01905         
01906     /* evaluate child-strip into tmp_channels buffer before accumulating 
01907      * in the accumulation buffer
01908      */
01909     nlastrip_evaluate(ptr, &tmp_channels, &tmp_modifiers, tmp_nes);
01910     
01911     /* assumulate temp-buffer and full-buffer, using the 'real' strip */
01912     nlaevalchan_buffers_accumulate(channels, &tmp_channels, nes);
01913     
01914     /* free temp eval-strip */
01915     MEM_freeN(tmp_nes);
01916     
01917     /* unlink this strip's modifiers from the parent's modifiers again */
01918     nlaeval_fmodifiers_split_stacks(&strip->modifiers, modifiers);
01919 }
01920 
01921 /* evaluates the given evaluation strip */
01922 void nlastrip_evaluate (PointerRNA *ptr, ListBase *channels, ListBase *modifiers, NlaEvalStrip *nes)
01923 {
01924     NlaStrip *strip= nes->strip;
01925     
01926     /* to prevent potential infinite recursion problems (i.e. transition strip, beside meta strip containing a transition
01927      * several levels deep inside it), we tag the current strip as being evaluated, and clear this when we leave
01928      */
01929     // TODO: be careful with this flag, since some edit tools may be running and have set this while animplayback was running
01930     if (strip->flag & NLASTRIP_FLAG_EDIT_TOUCHED)
01931         return;
01932     strip->flag |= NLASTRIP_FLAG_EDIT_TOUCHED;
01933     
01934     /* actions to take depend on the type of strip */
01935     switch (strip->type) {
01936         case NLASTRIP_TYPE_CLIP: /* action-clip */
01937             nlastrip_evaluate_actionclip(ptr, channels, modifiers, nes);
01938             break;
01939         case NLASTRIP_TYPE_TRANSITION: /* transition */
01940             nlastrip_evaluate_transition(ptr, channels, modifiers, nes);
01941             break;
01942         case NLASTRIP_TYPE_META: /* meta */
01943             nlastrip_evaluate_meta(ptr, channels, modifiers, nes);
01944             break;
01945             
01946         default: /* do nothing */
01947             break;
01948     }
01949     
01950     /* clear temp recursion safe-check */
01951     strip->flag &= ~NLASTRIP_FLAG_EDIT_TOUCHED;
01952 }
01953 
01954 /* write the accumulated settings to */
01955 void nladata_flush_channels (ListBase *channels)
01956 {
01957     NlaEvalChannel *nec;
01958     
01959     /* sanity checks */
01960     if (channels == NULL)
01961         return;
01962     
01963     /* for each channel with accumulated values, write its value on the property it affects */
01964     for (nec= channels->first; nec; nec= nec->next) {
01965         PointerRNA *ptr= &nec->ptr;
01966         PropertyRNA *prop= nec->prop;
01967         int array_index= nec->index;
01968         float value= nec->value;
01969         
01970         /* write values - see animsys_write_rna_setting() to sync the code */
01971         switch (RNA_property_type(prop)) 
01972         {
01973             case PROP_BOOLEAN:
01974                 if (RNA_property_array_length(ptr, prop))
01975                     RNA_property_boolean_set_index(ptr, prop, array_index, ANIMSYS_FLOAT_AS_BOOL(value));
01976                 else
01977                     RNA_property_boolean_set(ptr, prop, ANIMSYS_FLOAT_AS_BOOL(value));
01978                 break;
01979             case PROP_INT:
01980                 if (RNA_property_array_length(ptr, prop))
01981                     RNA_property_int_set_index(ptr, prop, array_index, (int)value);
01982                 else
01983                     RNA_property_int_set(ptr, prop, (int)value);
01984                 break;
01985             case PROP_FLOAT:
01986                 if (RNA_property_array_length(ptr, prop))
01987                     RNA_property_float_set_index(ptr, prop, array_index, value);
01988                 else
01989                     RNA_property_float_set(ptr, prop, value);
01990                 break;
01991             case PROP_ENUM:
01992                 RNA_property_enum_set(ptr, prop, (int)value);
01993                 break;
01994             default:
01995                 // can't do anything with other types of property....
01996                 break;
01997         }
01998     }
01999 }
02000 
02001 /* ---------------------- */
02002 
02003 /* NLA Evaluation function - values are calculated and stored in temporary "NlaEvalChannels" 
02004  * ! This is exported so that keyframing code can use this for make use of it for anim layers support
02005  * > echannels: (list<NlaEvalChannels>) evaluation channels with calculated values
02006  */
02007 static void animsys_evaluate_nla (ListBase *echannels, PointerRNA *ptr, AnimData *adt, float ctime)
02008 {
02009     NlaTrack *nlt;
02010     short track_index=0;
02011     short has_strips = 0;
02012     
02013     ListBase estrips= {NULL, NULL};
02014     NlaEvalStrip *nes;
02015     
02016     /* 1. get the stack of strips to evaluate at current time (influence calculated here) */
02017     for (nlt=adt->nla_tracks.first; nlt; nlt=nlt->next, track_index++) { 
02018         /* stop here if tweaking is on and this strip is the tweaking track (it will be the first one that's 'disabled')... */
02019         if ((adt->flag & ADT_NLA_EDIT_ON) && (nlt->flag & NLATRACK_DISABLED))
02020             break;
02021             
02022         /* skip if we're only considering a track tagged 'solo' */
02023         if ((adt->flag & ADT_NLA_SOLO_TRACK) && (nlt->flag & NLATRACK_SOLO)==0)
02024             continue;
02025         /* skip if track is muted */
02026         if (nlt->flag & NLATRACK_MUTED) 
02027             continue;
02028             
02029         /* if this track has strips (but maybe they won't be suitable), set has_strips 
02030          *  - used for mainly for still allowing normal action evaluation...
02031          */
02032         if (nlt->strips.first)
02033             has_strips= 1;
02034             
02035         /* otherwise, get strip to evaluate for this channel */
02036         nes= nlastrips_ctime_get_strip(&estrips, &nlt->strips, track_index, ctime);
02037         if (nes) nes->track= nlt;
02038     }
02039     
02040     /* add 'active' Action (may be tweaking track) as last strip to evaluate in NLA stack
02041      *  - only do this if we're not exclusively evaluating the 'solo' NLA-track
02042      */
02043     if ((adt->action) && !(adt->flag & ADT_NLA_SOLO_TRACK)) {
02044         /* if there are strips, evaluate action as per NLA rules */
02045         if ((has_strips) || (adt->actstrip)) {
02046             /* make dummy NLA strip, and add that to the stack */
02047             NlaStrip dummy_strip= {NULL};
02048             ListBase dummy_trackslist;
02049             
02050             dummy_trackslist.first= dummy_trackslist.last= &dummy_strip;
02051             
02052             if ((nlt) && !(adt->flag & ADT_NLA_EDIT_NOMAP)) {
02053                 /* edit active action in-place according to its active strip, so copy the data  */
02054                 memcpy(&dummy_strip, adt->actstrip, sizeof(NlaStrip));
02055                 dummy_strip.next = dummy_strip.prev = NULL;
02056             }
02057             else {
02058                 /* set settings of dummy NLA strip from AnimData settings */
02059                 dummy_strip.act= adt->action;
02060                 dummy_strip.remap= adt->remap;
02061                 
02062                 /* action range is calculated taking F-Modifiers into account (which making new strips doesn't do due to the troublesome nature of that) */
02063                 calc_action_range(dummy_strip.act, &dummy_strip.actstart, &dummy_strip.actend, 1);
02064                 dummy_strip.start = dummy_strip.actstart;
02065                 dummy_strip.end = (IS_EQF(dummy_strip.actstart, dummy_strip.actend)) ?  (dummy_strip.actstart + 1.0f): (dummy_strip.actend);
02066                 
02067                 dummy_strip.blendmode= adt->act_blendmode;
02068                 dummy_strip.extendmode= adt->act_extendmode;
02069                 dummy_strip.influence= adt->act_influence;
02070             }
02071             
02072             /* add this to our list of evaluation strips */
02073             nlastrips_ctime_get_strip(&estrips, &dummy_trackslist, -1, ctime);
02074         }
02075         else {
02076             /* special case - evaluate as if there isn't any NLA data */
02077             // TODO: this is really just a stop-gap measure...
02078             animsys_evaluate_action(ptr, adt->action, adt->remap, ctime);
02079             return;
02080         }
02081     }
02082     
02083     /* only continue if there are strips to evaluate */
02084     if (estrips.first == NULL)
02085         return;
02086     
02087     
02088     /* 2. for each strip, evaluate then accumulate on top of existing channels, but don't set values yet */
02089     for (nes= estrips.first; nes; nes= nes->next) 
02090         nlastrip_evaluate(ptr, echannels, NULL, nes);
02091         
02092     /* 3. free temporary evaluation data that's not used elsewhere */
02093     BLI_freelistN(&estrips);
02094 }
02095 
02096 /* NLA Evaluation function (mostly for use through do_animdata) 
02097  *  - All channels that will be affected are not cleared anymore. Instead, we just evaluate into 
02098  *      some temp channels, where values can be accumulated in one go.
02099  */
02100 static void animsys_calculate_nla (PointerRNA *ptr, AnimData *adt, float ctime)
02101 {
02102     ListBase echannels= {NULL, NULL};
02103     
02104     // TODO: need to zero out all channels used, otherwise we have problems with threadsafety
02105     // and also when the user jumps between different times instead of moving sequentially...
02106     
02107     /* evaluate the NLA stack, obtaining a set of values to flush */
02108     animsys_evaluate_nla(&echannels, ptr, adt, ctime);
02109     
02110     /* flush effects of accumulating channels in NLA to the actual data they affect */
02111     nladata_flush_channels(&echannels);
02112     
02113     /* free temp data */
02114     BLI_freelistN(&echannels);
02115 }
02116 
02117 /* ***************************************** */ 
02118 /* Overrides System - Public API */
02119 
02120 /* Clear all overides */
02121 
02122 /* Add or get existing Override for given setting */
02123 #if 0
02124 AnimOverride *BKE_animsys_validate_override (PointerRNA *UNUSED(ptr), char *UNUSED(path), int UNUSED(array_index))
02125 {
02126     // FIXME: need to define how to get overrides
02127     return NULL;
02128 } 
02129 #endif
02130 
02131 /* -------------------- */
02132 
02133 /* Evaluate Overrides */
02134 static void animsys_evaluate_overrides (PointerRNA *ptr, AnimData *adt)
02135 {
02136     AnimOverride *aor;
02137     
02138     /* for each override, simply execute... */
02139     for (aor= adt->overrides.first; aor; aor= aor->next)
02140         animsys_write_rna_setting(ptr, aor->rna_path, aor->array_index, aor->value);
02141 }
02142 
02143 /* ***************************************** */
02144 /* Evaluation System - Public API */
02145 
02146 /* Overview of how this system works:
02147  *  1) Depsgraph sorts data as necessary, so that data is in an order that means 
02148  *      that all dependencies are resolved before dependants.
02149  *  2) All normal animation is evaluated, so that drivers have some basis values to
02150  *      work with
02151  *      a.  NLA stacks are done first, as the Active Actions act as 'tweaking' tracks
02152  *          which modify the effects of the NLA-stacks
02153  *      b.  Active Action is evaluated as per normal, on top of the results of the NLA tracks
02154  *
02155  * --------------< often in a separate phase... >------------------ 
02156  *
02157  *  3) Drivers/expressions are evaluated on top of this, in an order where dependencies are
02158  *      resolved nicely. 
02159  *     Note: it may be necessary to have some tools to handle the cases where some higher-level
02160  *      drivers are added and cause some problematic dependencies that didn't exist in the local levels...
02161  *
02162  * --------------< always executed >------------------ 
02163  *
02164  * Maintenance of editability of settings (XXX):
02165  *  In order to ensure that settings that are animated can still be manipulated in the UI without requiring
02166  *  that keyframes are added to prevent these values from being overwritten, we use 'overrides'. 
02167  *
02168  * Unresolved things:
02169  *  - Handling of multi-user settings (i.e. time-offset, group-instancing) -> big cache grids or nodal system? but stored where?
02170  *  - Multiple-block dependencies (i.e. drivers for settings are in both local and higher levels) -> split into separate lists? 
02171  *
02172  * Current Status:
02173  *  - Currently (as of September 2009), overrides we haven't needed to (fully) implement overrides. 
02174  *    However, the code for this is relatively harmless, so is left in the code for now.
02175  */
02176 
02177 /* Evaluation loop for evaluation animation data 
02178  *
02179  * This assumes that the animation-data provided belongs to the ID block in question,
02180  * and that the flags for which parts of the anim-data settings need to be recalculated 
02181  * have been set already by the depsgraph. Now, we use the recalc 
02182  */
02183 void BKE_animsys_evaluate_animdata (Scene *scene, ID *id, AnimData *adt, float ctime, short recalc)
02184 {
02185     PointerRNA id_ptr;
02186     
02187     /* sanity checks */
02188     if (ELEM(NULL, id, adt))
02189         return;
02190     
02191     /* get pointer to ID-block for RNA to use */
02192     RNA_id_pointer_create(id, &id_ptr);
02193     
02194     /* recalculate keyframe data:
02195      *  - NLA before Active Action, as Active Action behaves as 'tweaking track'
02196      *    that overrides 'rough' work in NLA
02197      */
02198     // TODO: need to double check that this all works correctly
02199     if ((recalc & ADT_RECALC_ANIM) || (adt->recalc & ADT_RECALC_ANIM)) {
02200         /* evaluate NLA data */
02201         if ((adt->nla_tracks.first) && !(adt->flag & ADT_NLA_EVAL_OFF)) {
02202             /* evaluate NLA-stack 
02203              *  - active action is evaluated as part of the NLA stack as the last item
02204              */
02205             animsys_calculate_nla(&id_ptr, adt, ctime);
02206         }
02207         /* evaluate Active Action only */
02208         else if (adt->action)
02209             animsys_evaluate_action(&id_ptr, adt->action, adt->remap, ctime);
02210         
02211         /* reset tag */
02212         adt->recalc &= ~ADT_RECALC_ANIM;
02213     }
02214     
02215     /* recalculate drivers 
02216      *  - Drivers need to be evaluated afterwards, as they can either override 
02217      *    or be layered on top of existing animation data.
02218      *  - Drivers should be in the appropriate order to be evaluated without problems...
02219      */
02220     if ((recalc & ADT_RECALC_DRIVERS) /*&& (adt->recalc & ADT_RECALC_DRIVERS)*/) // XXX for now, don't check yet, as depsgraph hasn't been updated
02221     {
02222         animsys_evaluate_drivers(&id_ptr, adt, ctime);
02223     }
02224     
02225     /* always execute 'overrides' 
02226      *  - Overrides allow editing, by overwriting the value(s) set from animation-data, with the
02227      *    value last set by the user (and not keyframed yet). 
02228      *  - Overrides are cleared upon frame change and/or keyframing
02229      *  - It is best that we execute this everytime, so that no errors are likely to occur.
02230      */
02231     animsys_evaluate_overrides(&id_ptr, adt);
02232     
02233     /* execute and clear all cached property update functions */
02234     if (scene) {
02235         Main *bmain = G.main; // xxx - to get passed in!
02236         RNA_property_update_cache_flush(bmain, scene);
02237         RNA_property_update_cache_free();
02238     }
02239     
02240     /* clear recalc flag now */
02241     adt->recalc= 0;
02242 }
02243 
02244 /* Evaluation of all ID-blocks with Animation Data blocks - Animation Data Only
02245  *
02246  * This will evaluate only the animation info available in the animation data-blocks
02247  * encountered. In order to enforce the system by which some settings controlled by a
02248  * 'local' (i.e. belonging in the nearest ID-block that setting is related to, not a
02249  * standard 'root') block are overridden by a larger 'user'
02250  */
02251 void BKE_animsys_evaluate_all_animation (Main *main, Scene *scene, float ctime)
02252 {
02253     ID *id;
02254 
02255     if (G.debug & G_DEBUG)
02256         printf("Evaluate all animation - %f\n", ctime);
02257     
02258     /* macros for less typing 
02259      *  - only evaluate animation data for id if it has users (and not just fake ones)
02260      *  - whether animdata exists is checked for by the evaluation function, though taking 
02261      *    this outside of the function may make things slightly faster?
02262      */
02263 #define EVAL_ANIM_IDS(first, aflag) \
02264     for (id= first; id; id= id->next) { \
02265         if (ID_REAL_USERS(id) > 0) { \
02266             AnimData *adt= BKE_animdata_from_id(id); \
02267             BKE_animsys_evaluate_animdata(scene, id, adt, ctime, aflag); \
02268         } \
02269     }
02270     /* another macro for the "embedded" nodetree cases 
02271      *  - this is like EVAL_ANIM_IDS, but this handles the case "embedded nodetrees" 
02272      *    (i.e. scene/material/texture->nodetree) which we need a special exception
02273      *    for, otherwise they'd get skipped
02274      *  - ntp = "node tree parent" = datablock where node tree stuff resides
02275      */
02276 #define EVAL_ANIM_NODETREE_IDS(first, NtId_Type, aflag) \
02277     for (id= first; id; id= id->next) { \
02278         if (ID_REAL_USERS(id) > 0) { \
02279             AnimData *adt= BKE_animdata_from_id(id); \
02280             NtId_Type *ntp= (NtId_Type *)id; \
02281             if (ntp->nodetree) { \
02282                 AnimData *adt2= BKE_animdata_from_id((ID *)ntp->nodetree); \
02283                 BKE_animsys_evaluate_animdata(scene, (ID *)ntp->nodetree, adt2, ctime, ADT_RECALC_ANIM); \
02284             } \
02285             BKE_animsys_evaluate_animdata(scene, id, adt, ctime, aflag); \
02286         } \
02287     }
02288     
02289     /* optimization: 
02290      * when there are no actions, don't go over database and loop over heaps of datablocks, 
02291      * which should ultimately be empty, since it is not possible for now to have any animation 
02292      * without some actions, and drivers wouldn't get affected by any state changes
02293      *
02294      * however, if there are some curves, we will need to make sure that their 'ctime' property gets
02295      * set correctly, so this optimization must be skipped in that case...
02296      */
02297     if ((main->action.first == NULL) && (main->curve.first == NULL)) {
02298         if (G.debug & G_DEBUG)
02299             printf("\tNo Actions, so no animation needs to be evaluated...\n");
02300             
02301         return;
02302     }
02303     
02304     /* nodes */
02305     EVAL_ANIM_IDS(main->nodetree.first, ADT_RECALC_ANIM);
02306     
02307     /* textures */
02308     EVAL_ANIM_NODETREE_IDS(main->tex.first, Tex, ADT_RECALC_ANIM);
02309     
02310     /* lamps */
02311     EVAL_ANIM_NODETREE_IDS(main->lamp.first, Lamp, ADT_RECALC_ANIM);
02312

02347         /* ADT_RECALC_ANIM doesn't need to be supplied here, since object AnimData gets 
02348          * this tagged by Depsgraph on framechange. This optimization means that objects
02349          * linked from other (not-visible) scenes will not need their data calculated.
